args:
With help from the Halidom, Ieyasu's
excavation bears fruit in the form of a golden
statue. He soon realizes, however, that all of
his discoveries were planted in the well by
Mitsuhide, and presses her to explain herself.
Galvanized by the discovery of a curious cave\nbeneath the well, Ieyasu and the others call in\na favor from a certain group of do-gooders.
I grabbed everyone from the castle who\nlooked like they could handle a shovel.
Stand back and watch how a REAL treasure\nhunter does it!
Let's get this dig started. Oh, treeeasure!\nCome out, come out, wherever you aaare!
Lazry says she'll whip up any\ntools we need for the job.
I thank you all for making the journey here.
Aw, please. We're all here 'cause it\nsounded like a fun time.
Right? They had me at ＂lost gold＂!
Ieyasu sure has made this into a spectacle.
Just shows how serious he is about it. Plus\nhe knows we're on a tight schedule here.
I'd say he's a step beyond ＂serious＂ and\ninto ＂scary＂ territory, but that's just me.
I believe an important historical truth lies\nburied within this cavern.
I ask your aid in helping me unearth\nthese secrets and bring them to light.

So it was that the excavation effort began in
earnest. The joint team of Hinomotoan and
Halidom experts took picks in hand to plumb
the cavern depths.
Their eyes gleaming with anticipation, one and all\nfound their enthusiasm rewarded with discovery\nafter unbelievable discovery.
Hey. Check out what Renelle dug up.
A broken piece of pottery. A teacup,\nperhaps, judging by its shape?
Musta belonged to the guy who carved\nthis place out.
Now Pietro's found something!\nEverybody, come look!
A teacup, a rusty tool, some old lumber... Did all\nof it have something to do with the buried gold?\nMorale surged with every subsequent uncovering.
Meanwhile, a feat of Rokkan engineering certain\nto help the effort was on the cusp of completion.
Uses mana to spin the blades SUPER fast,\ncarving right through even the toughest\nboulders, she says! Amazing, huh?!
I'm guessin' you're not the biggest fan\nof technology like this, as a dragon.
I'm not as uptight as the rest. Besides, I'm\nconfident I could bust more rocks than that\nsilly thing any day.
Hey, you don't know that for sure. This\nthing's supposed to get stronger the more\nmana you pump into it. Who knows if—
Oh, let the poor thing explain it herself.

Imperial forces assaulted the camp time and
again, but our intrepid explorers wouldn't be
deterred from their task. Nothing could slow
their progress!
Next time, you're REALLY gonna get it!
Oh, you look terrible, sirs! Come and stay\nat our inn. You'll feel worlds better!
Gah! Not YOU people again. You're\nalways buzzing around like a pack of flies!
The inn may be old as dirt and falling\napart, but they wait on you hand and foot.\nIt's actually SUPER cozy there...
Yeah, plus the waitress there's a real cutie!\nI think we should listen to 'em, boss. It's\nimportant to rest after a hard day's work!
HEY! Will you lazy goons get BACK here?!\n...At least wait for me!
They never get tired of this, huh?\nWish they'd take a hint.
There's a silver lining, though—every time\nthey come back to recover at the village,\nwe get to cash in. Tourism is booming!
Word's gotten out that you all are digging\nfor buried treasure, and it's brought us\ncurious sightseers in droves.
Truly, thank you so much.\nBecause of you, our village is—
We're not out of the woods here just yet.\nProject Celestial Rock Cave is about ready\nto head into its next phase.
Let's take a breather, folks. We've found a\nton of promising junk down there, but still\nno sign of the gold.
True. Yet I'm thoroughly enjoying myself\nfinding traces that my ancestor, the tanuki,\nmay once have been here.
I can relate. It's kind of electrifying to feel\na concrete connection to folks from the\ndistant past.
But, uh, didn't this tanuki character\nsupposedly run off with your family's\nmoney?
I hope to learn the truth before I tell his\nstory. I feel I owe him that courtesy.
If we uncover proof of his guilt here, I will\ncarry the lessons of his betrayal with me.
But if he was innocent, I see it as my\nduty as his descendant to set the record\nstraight.
Not sure if this helps at all, but Gauld said\nsomething about the guy who dug that\ncavern.
Apparently, the stone support wall\ndoesn't extend past the entrance.
It was built that way to keep the place\nfrom caving in. Seems like they ran out\nof materials partway through, though.
The fact that they kept digging anyway\ndespite the risks means they must've\nbeen pretty desperate.
Heeey, Ieyasu! Our friends found\nsomething wild at the back of the cave!
Oh, you're here. Have a look at this.
My word! A golden dragon statue?!
Whoaaa! Think this is part of the buried\ntreasure trove?
I dunno. The way it was told in Ieyasu's\nfamily, the war funds were in gold bars.
Stories have a way of changing over time.\nAt the very least, this means it's likely that\nmore treasure is waiting deeper inside.
It's gettin' late, guys. Let's pick this back\nup tomorrow. Tonight, I say we party hard\nto celebrate our big find!
I'll go ask the village chief if we can rent\nout the dining hall. Let's go.
Marty, might I have a word?
My apologies for the imposition,\nbut I've a favor to ask of you.
So it WAS your work.\nI suspected as much.
...Nh? What is it, Ieyasu?\nGive me five more minutes...
There's something I'd like you to hear.\nI asked Marty to appraise the golden\nstatue we unearthed yesterday.
He reported that it was carved of wood\nand coated in a thin layer of gold foil.
What's more, he said it was recent\nin make. Extremely recent, in fact.
That isn't all. Given its new coat of paint,\nI did not recognize it immediately, but I\nknow that statue.
I recall seeing it on offer at a souvenir\nshop during a visit to your lands.
All of which leads me to conclude that the\ncounterfeit gold statue was placed there by\nyou, Mitsuhide.
